intro: Tacarcuna, commonly known as the sacred tree of the Yagé shamans, is a species of tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the genus Psychotria and is part of the Rubiaceae family. The plant is notable for its small, fragrant flowers and its role in traditional medicine and spiritual practices. Its leaves and berries contain psychoactive compounds, including dimethyltryptamine (DMT). Due to its cultural and medicinal significance, Tacarcuna is often revered in indigenous communities.
